column4: i typed "sudo reboot" into my terminal now everything is jakced up.....any ideas?
is it in the middle of rebootin, maybe?
no it rebooted fine, but when it came back online i was at a screen with nothing but a terminal in the top left corner
it was an all black screen no window borders couldnt move the terminal around but terminal worked fine...then i typed in gnome-session and i got to the desktop but it was missing my panels
then i rebooted again it it was back at the all black screen with terminal in the left corner
did it have a text or graphical login screen?
graphical and i have auto login
oh...no idea how to change to "failsafe gnome" with auto-login...can you log out?
sorry i got busy...yeah i can log out i think...its on my laptop though an battery is dead atm and i dont have a charger with me
well try logging out and choosing failsafe gnome on the login screen
whenyou get battery
what can I do after choosing failsafe gnome to get my desktop back???
well im guessing failsafe has a better chance of working than default
so it might actually work
i dont want to just use failsafe though?
at least check with that to be sure its your config thats broken and not something more major
well how can i check config?
im thinking that im just gonna to "sudo apt-get remove ubuntu-desktop && sudo aptitude install ubuntu-desktop"
that may fix it
that wont change your configuration files in $HOME
so im f'ed in the a?
try the failsafe gnome and see how it goes. if it works, its something in your config files (probably ~/.config)
ok ill do that whne i get some juice back in the laptop...thanks
